sections.1_story_intuition: Railway headquarters are the central administrative offices for each railway zone in India. Knowing the headquarters is crucial for competitive exams, as questions often test your memory of which city hosts the HQ for each zone. This topic is a high-frequency area in RRB, SSC, and other government exams.
2_key_definitions: Headquarters: Main administrative office of a railway zone.
Railway Zone: Administrative region of Indian Railways.
Division: Sub-unit within a zone, each with its own office.
General Manager: Head of a railway zone.
IRCTC: Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation.
Metro Railway: Urban rapid transit system (Kolkata).
Konkan Railway: Special railway zone with HQ in Navi Mumbai.
Freight Corridor: Dedicated goods train route.
Railway Board: Apex body of Indian Railways.
Suburban Railway: Local train network in cities.
3_key_facts_data_points: There are 18 railway zones in India (2025).
Each zone has a unique headquarters city.
North East Frontier Railway HQ: Maligaon (Guwahati).
South East Central Railway HQ: Bilaspur.
7_traps_confusing_points: Assuming all HQs are in state capitals.
Confusing Metro Railway with city metros.
Mixing up North Central and North Eastern HQs.
Assuming Konkan is a regular zone.
Mixing up South Central and South Coast HQs.
Mixing up Kolkata HQs (Eastern, South Eastern, Metro).
Assuming all HQs are in the same city as the zone name.

8_case_study_context.title: Why HQ Locations Matter in Railways
8_case_study_context.explanation: The location of a railway zone's headquarters affects regional management, resource allocation, and operational efficiency. For example, having two HQs in Mumbai (Central and Western) helps manage the dense rail network in Maharashtra.
